reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a couple of nights at Bosworth Hall Hotel on the 7th & 8th of August. Considering the price - we did not expect a luxury break but had planned to use the hotel as abase to explore the surrounding areas.
reviews.title: Excellent value - would return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: On arrival, reception staff were helpful and we were booked in quickly. Our room was acceptable for the price paid, I actually thought it was quaint and a reasonable size with clean towels and bedding, only negative was that there were areas not thoroughly cleaned, for example around the windows. Also the bathroom grouting could do with a good bleaching. So I would say that the cleaning routines need to be reviewed.
reviews.title: cheap deal, that says it all!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid 138 GBP for dinner B&B for two nights - which included a bottle of wine each night and entry into Spindles Health Club.
reviews.title: better than we expected, very busy but efficiently run

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast and dinner was very good for the price paid, and we met a couple of very nice people in the bar after dinner. I would advise you book into the restaurant as soon as you arrive as it gets very busy. You can pay a small supplement and dine in the a le carte if you so prefar
reviews.title: Great 2 day break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would estimate the average age of people staying here to be in their late 40's early 50's, so it is not a place for the younger generation as the whole ambience is rather low key (unless you are part of a wedding party) It is obviously not a luxurious or 'foody' break, but does represent excellent value for money as a less expensive weekend get-away.
reviews.title: What Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked our trip through travelzoo so did not expect much, however we did expect to be able to sleep! We checked in at 4 pm planning on a trip to the spa and enjoying dinner around 7 to 8 - WRONG! We were allocated room 220 which was very difficult to find if you would like to take the lift to it. We had a lot of luggage as we had been travelling around, which reception could clearly see. The room was in the attic approached by a small spiral staircase, after struggling up there we were less than impressed, the room was hot and stuffy and overlooked a flat roof - it looked like staff quarters from the turn of the century! As for the television, well I have taken better sets to the tip!
reviews.title: Sleepless in Bosworth Hall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: However we then moved to the restaurant to book our table we were offered 8.45 at the earliest
reviews.title: A tad tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was a lot later than we would have liked so we went to reception to speak to the manager. After a discussion the manager agreed we could eat early as long as were in the restaurant at 6 as it was now 5 no chance of a visit to the spa! The manager offered us another room, the only one available was 129 which the reception lad took us to, it was again very hot but we thought that was just us as we had got overheated bearing the luggage, there was a noise from an extractor fan outside as the room was above the kitchen we were assured this went off at 10.
reviews.title: dont stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The kitchen fan did not go off at 10, it paused briefly at around 1am but kept going all night, at midnight we asked reception for a fan as our room was stifling, I could appreciate this if it had been hot outside but it was a cool evening. There were no fans available as they had not been pat tested! We did not even get into bed but laid on the top dozing occasionally it was the worst night we have ever spent in a hotel. Never accept rooms 220 or 129.
reviews.title: 2 night break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: The carvery food was fine if you are partial to frozen Brakes food reheated. It certainly did not bother the oap's sitting near us who consumed 2 main courses and many desserts, the queues were long and it was a bit of a fight to get to the food. No chance of a cosy meal for 2, it was more like eating in a staff canteen.
reviews.title: Avoid at all costs if you have walking difficulties

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back in June we booked a double exec. room for 3 nights dbb, £198.00. This was through the Britannia Hotels own website. We checked in and went to our room, only to find it was far from an exec. room, it even had frosted glass in all of the windows!
reviews.title: Check they have not down graded you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I went back down to reception and was told that "because I had booked through Travelzoo, I could not expect an exec double", and as they were fully booked there was nothing they could do, other than refund me £15.00 per night. I insisted that I had not booked through Travelzoo, but the receptionist still was adamant that I had to stay in the cheap and nasty room, she even had a smile on her face when telling me this. Another, older lady in reception, even had the cheek to but in and say that the exec. rooms were very expensive, as though I was not entitled to stay in one!
reviews.title: Really enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outcome, after 2 hours of phoning the hotel's central reservations etc., was that I ended up in a family room, with clear windows and a £60.00 refund. I would have preferred to have had the room we had booked and paid for.
reviews.title: Some good points and some terrible points!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: IF I HADN'T GONE TO ALL THIS TROUBLE, THE HOTEL WOULD HAVE HAPPILY TAKEN THE MONEY FOR THE EXEC ROOM, OND ONLY FURNISHED US WITH A VERY SMALL AND BASIC DOUBLE ROOM.
reviews.title: A lovely 6 days away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel, good value for money, which is being spoilt by some members of staff. Perhaps they should pull their heads out of their backsides and take a look out.
reviews.title: Friendly, welcoming, relaxing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights 8 & 9 august thought it was very good value for money the leasure club included was a nice touch.will come again!!!
reviews.title: Good value hotel break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a couple of nights at Bosworth Hall Hotel on 7/8 August. After reading the reviews, and bearing in mind the price, we did not expect a luxury break but hoped our room would be clean and comfortable. On arrival, we were most interested to see the Hall but a little disappointed to hear that we had been allocated a lower ground floor room. However, the room was reasonably spacious, clean and comfortable. The hotel was an interesting place to stay and we wondered around looking at all the features and portraits, etc. We got a free bottle of wine on both nights and entry into Spindles Health Club as well as DBB so thought very good value at £120 for the two nights. The Hotel is a few minutes walk from Market Bosworth. The location is very good but was slightly spoilt on our stay because of the rain. We were also a little disappointed to find out that there were no steam trains running on 8 August as this was something we had looked forward to. The church within the grounds is definitely worth a visit. Overall an enjoyable and extremely good value break. Has encouraged us to consider other Britannia hotels.
reviews.title: Better than expected - great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: we took up a Travel Zoo offer ( very reasonably priced) and went with a large group of friends, the house and surrounding park is quite lovely, magnificent trees and a lovely stroll through the churchyard to village ( small and perfectly formed). Mixed reviews on our rooms, some quite tired and needing serious refresh, others fine.I was unhappy not to have mattress cover on our bed, a given surely, l should have complained,the bathroom poor. Staff generally courteous, but during the 1 hour free bar staff appeared strained and not a smile to be had,rather takes the shine off what should be a happy time! the system perhaps could be simplified for them. Restaurant staff quite young and not terribly happy either. Lovely lady serving in cocktail bar overlooking the terrace made up for them though, a lovely room. Food was good, carvery meat delicious,puds boring and very calorific and no fresh fruit option. Breakfasts good, we all enjoyed them. This is a tough one, not a high standard hotel, but we all enjoyed our stay, and made use of pool. Would dissuade anyone not prepared to grin and bear the faults to give this one a miss
reviews.title: not for the fainthearted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, after reading the many reviews on Tripadviser, I have to report very positively back from our 2 days just spent at this lovely venue! We were unsure of what to expect, but to our joy, found a fantastic venue, warm welcome, pleasant room and excellent food & facilities! All in all what a bargain find! We booked through Travelzoo & had an amazing deal for these 2 nights, in fact quite unbelievable! We like the spa facilities so this was a brill deal. On leaving today I filled in the questionaire - other than positive comments, the only things I suggested were: a tip box, as the staff were amazing, perhaps at the reception area where people could if this wished!; a map of the local walks, as we walked the local Ashby canal and would have found this helpful; greater knowledge of the local steam train timetables [they don't run on Mondays]; we walked to the local English heritage sight of the Battle of Bosworth - it would have been good if the walks had been available. On saying this - we could have found this info out prior to leaving home on the internet I suppose, but I feel the hotel could benefit from providing this info. The leisure facilities were great and the gym a real bonus, not expecting such up-to-date equipment and such a range. All in all a fab stay & will return in the Autumn when the trees start to 'turn' as the grounds are fabulous! Remember that pets are allowed in the hotel, which is a surprise if not expected. Enjoy your stay!
reviews.title: A real find! Will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very sceptical after some of the reviews we had read prior to arrival. However we arrived for our 3 night dinner, bed and breakfast deal, (£198.00 all in) and were delighted on our arrival.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We read the feedback on trip advisor and were a little worried about staying here .I had driven through Market Bosworth before and seen the Hotel from the road and couldn`t believe my luck when I saw an offer for bed and breakfast for £59 per room.We have nothing but praise for this Hotel. The staff are very friendly and welcoming and nothing is too much trouble. Believe me I asked for a variety of things to "test" them. We booked 3 rooms last minute for 2 nightst and found this Hotel to be very good value for money. We were placed in adjacent rooms which was brilliant and made for an easier family break.We were a party of 5 adults 1 toddler and a baby.There was a travel cot set up ready for my Grandson. I found the bed a little hard but thats just me. Yes we had to wait for a breakfast table on the first morning because we all wanted to sit together but this was no inconvieniece to us and we were accomodated in a large dining room which was beautiful.So the plates are small but I managed to get 10 pro points on my plate in the mornings trust me that is a lot of food. I had planned to take my Grandson out for the day but ended up spending the whole day at the Hotel exploring the nooks and crannies swimming in the pool picniking in the grounds and enjoying the woodland walk. He was even encouraged to run around in the hotel and let off steam .Market Bosworth is a delightful little village which has a variety of eating places if you require them.Hopefully we will return to Bosworth Hall.
reviews.title: Bosworth Hall Hotel
Unimpressed with the bar meal and staff lacked training on customer service.
reviews.text: We called in here for a bar meal after a recommendation about the carvery(carvery closed on Saturday). I sent my lasagne back as it was so hard around the edges even my knife couldn't cut it. The girl seemed totally disinterested and just stared at me when I said I wanted a new one. After a 20 minute wait I returned to find out where my lasagne was. The girl was sat at a table and made no attempt to get up to find out. Only a young lad passing through stopped to apologise and I don't think he even worked in there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: When it did come out it was ok. Not worth the £7.95 and certainly not worth a 20 minute wait. I think 3 minutes in the microwave would've done it.
reviews.title: 4 day stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving through the town on the way home there seemed lots of lovely pubs so they will get our custom next time.
reviews.title: get a new chef....!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: found the hotel clean comfortable,
reviews.title: Ignore the picky bad reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: we got a great deal, £190 for 5 night for a family of 3 DBB.The building is filled with character and beauty. You will need to book your evening meal as it gets very busy. Meals are tasty and plentyfull (watch out for the greedy guests who feel the need to stuff themselves stupid)
reviews.title: So stunning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are friendly and polite but the gem in the crown of Bosworth hotel for me was the grounds! just beautiful. The leisure centre has all the facilities you could ask for. On a slightly negative note, The free bar hour lowers the tone of the whole hotel, the queue for the bar is ten deep, we ate out dinner from 6-7 pm to avoid it,
reviews.title: lovely hotel and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: book your table for your evening meal when you arrive .
reviews.title: Great value, beautiful building and village - friendly staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: This hotel is worth a visit as it's in a beautiful location. The beds we had were comfy, the breakfast and carvery dinner were decent enough and at a good price. We stayed for 2 nights with our 2 young children in a standard family room (2x double beds) whilst attending a local wedding and would have been happy to stay a further night. The swimming pool and health club facilities are modern & clean. Although there is no specific children's facilities, the kids were made to feel very welcome. The hotel was very busy, but this didn't really bother us. The room decor is rather out of date and in need of freshening up, but for the money, I wasn't expecting something newly done and of a very high standard. Market Bosworth is so pretty and well worth exploring.
reviews.title: Great value, lovely settting...Travelzoo offer is a steal!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are mixed reviews of this hotel and I can see if you've paid full price for a stay then you may be a little disappointed, however booking through the Travelzoo offer gives a fantastic deal which is fantastic value for money. Don't be fooled by the main pictures of this hotel, it is not all grand and stately home like...there is a newer annex at the rear, however the hotel is still set in the beautiful grounds of the original estate.
reviews.title: lovely weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from Bosworth Hall after a very disappointing two night stay. Thankfully it was a Travelzoo Offer and we didn't pay full price. We upgraded our room to a suite which while clean and tidy was poorly furnished and overlooked the air extraction units which run all night. Our main complaint was the restaurant. We were expecting the a la carte restaurant to be open but is only open Friday and Saturday, the alternative being the carvery which felt 'tacky'. We ate at 8pm and there was little meat left and served as if it still had to go a long way, I went for the fish which was oven baked from frozen and quite tasteless. served with overcooked vegetables. Starter was packet soup (no choice) and deserts bought in - non of which was appealing. Breakfast was not dissimilar - not very well presented and barely warm. There is a serious lack of attention to detail - spilled cereals over the floor and dispensers, sticky and tacky around fruit juice dispensers which were not labelled so it was guesswork as to what you were drinking. Sadly I feel they cater for the coach trade of elderly visitors and provide low quality food on small plates, while with just a little more effort could appeal to a wider audience. Shame, it is a lovely property in a nice location spoilt by cutting corners. We did get a free bottle of wine - house white which was presented with 2 glasses, no wine bucket to keep it chilled, which was mediocre but sadly the only wine available by the glass is the house wine. So disappointed that we ate in the pub in Market Bosworth on our second evening. Oh! we also had free use of the swimming pool which was being redecorated! Would we return, definitely not.
reviews.title: Old Peoples Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled solo
reviews.title: This is not a rave review. Far from it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: luxury at bosworth hall hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently joined Spindles Health Club as a member. First impressions do count. On signing up with no complicated contract and at £25 per month this is good value. However, similar to a minority of hotel reviews, apart from swimming pool and jacuzzi the changing room metal lockers, all gym equipment is tired and must be 30 years old. Some of the latter in need of replacement or repair. The sauna cabin uninviting has loose and damaged lats and in need of repair or a complete cabin replacement. The swimming pool area is being re-emulsioned. If the sauna cabin was replaced it would be more inviting for members and hotel guests alike.
reviews.title: Great Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Moving on to the location of the installed snooker table on the first floor area. As an experienced former championship snooker player, I do know a bit about it. In its isolated position without supervision and with complete novices using the table, the cloth may get ripped. Far better to site the table in the Leisure Club under limited supervision. A snooker table size 12' x 6' needs an area 22' x 16' to accommodate.
reviews.title: Could be a pleasent hotel - if they didn't fill it so full

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 1 night stay at Bosworth Hall Hotel which we booked for our 1st wedding anniversary. We saw the Travelzoo offer of a night's stay, carvery dinner, full breakfast, use of Spindles Leisure club and a bottle of house red or white wine for £59. This seemed like outstanding value for money. I read some reviews on Tripadvisor and thought I would upgrade the room to an Executive room and paid £20 extra for this and was told on the phone that our room would be overlooking the lawns, which it wasn't. It had a tiny window in the corner of the room (which was almost triangular) and looked out onto a tiny outside space of bushes which was not what I was expecting. The room was very tired - the bathroom was a good size with bath and overhead shower, however, it was in desperate need of a lick of paint as was the bedroom which had scuff marks all over the walls. The bed was incredibly uncomfortable unfortunately and neither myself nor my husband managed to sleep well at all. There was also a used tissue between the duvet cover and the bed sheet when we went to go to sleep which was quite off putting! This Executive Double room was very basic and I was honestly quite disappointed with it considering we had 'upgraded' (I dread to think what the 'standard' rooms are like)!
reviews.title: Mixed feelings but the bottom line is you get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: However, we arrived early on the Sunday (at about 12.30 instead of the stipulated 2pm) and the receptionist said our room was ready so we were able to book in earlier than we had expected which was very much appreciated. We went for a walk around the grounds which are absolutely beautiful and the building itself is just stunning. We found a little 'secret garden' and took our picnic there which we'd brought from home and sat in the sunshine which was lovely.
reviews.title: Disappointed before my stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spindles Health/Leisure club was open during our stay and had just been refurbished. It of course smelt heavily of paint which was unappealing but we did know this had just been redecorated and we couldn't expect the smell just to disappear so we didn't mind about that. The jacuzzi is a proper jacuzzi which actually works and is hot which was great, there is a hydra shower which is the most powerful and wonderful shower I've ever experienced!! The sauna was great until I sat in the corner without realising the bench was broken and 2 nails were sticking out which of course ended up embedded in my backside!! I was quite shocked that this had not been put out of use considering the danger lerking inside!!
reviews.title: Could have been so much better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought we'd play a game of snooker so went to reception to ask where to find the snooker table and the poor receptionist didn't know where it was! She had only been there for a few weeks and was otherwise very helpful and friendly - I just feel that there is certainly a lack of attention to detail in the staff training. We'd also asked at the bar for the channel to be turned over so we could watch the Grand Prix but the bar person didn't know how to do it and didn't ask anyone else nor did she seem particularly bothered about our request.
reviews.title: Value for Money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The carvery dinner was not of great quality but we didn't expect it to be a fine dining experience - so we were not put out by this and in fact, there was quite a good selection when you consider the amount you pay to start with. I think they do the best they can with the rates they charge, so not bad value for money in all honesty.
reviews.title: not a warm welcome
